metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000077 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
RubyGems version Ruby 2.2 series: 2.2.9 and earlier, Ruby 2.3 series: 2.3.6and earlier, Ruby 2.4 series: 2.4.3 and earlier, Ruby 2.5 series: 2.5.0 andearlier, prior to trunk revision 62422 contains a Improper Input Validationvulnerability in ruby gems specification homepage attribute that can resultin a malicious gem could set an invalid homepage URL. This vulnerabilityappears to have been fixed in 2.7.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000077` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 9.1.17.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jruby package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.17.0-3').
